title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Mpika Wind Power Project, through DNV GL Energy USA, Inc, f/k/a DNV KEMA Renewables, Inc.

description.narrative: A USTDA grant to Gobeleq Zambia Wind Limited funds a feasibility study for a proposed 100 MW wind power project near Mpika, Zambia. The study provides the project with the technical analysis needed to support the project in advancing towards financial close. DNV KEMA Renewables, Inc., is carrying out the feasibility study. This project is anticipated to be among Zambia's first utility-scale wind power plants, and will assist in diversifying the country's energy supply.

title.narrative: Masaiti Hybrid Wind, Solar, and Energy Storage Project, through U.S. Government - Trade and Development Agency

description.narrative: A USTDA grant to Upepo Energy Zambia, LLC funds a feasibility study ("Study") for an anticipated 150 MW wind, solar and storage hybrid project in Masaiti, Zambia ("Project"). The Study will help determine the technical, economic and environmental feasibility for the Project, including the optimal combination of renewable generation resources and energy storage. The U.S. firm, WSP USA, Inc., is completing the study on a sole-source basis.

title.narrative: Standard Microgrid Initiatives Limited Deployment Microgrid Units, through DNV Energy Insights USA, Inc.

description.narrative: This grant to Standard Microgrid Initiatives Limited funds a feasibility study and site assessment ("Study") for the deployment of an estimated 125 standardized microgrid units in Zambia ("Project"). The Study will demonstrate the competitiveness of U.S. solar and storage technologies in a relatively untapped market, and is anticipated to provide access to electricity for up to 22,500 households. The Project is expected to serve as the first large-scale deployment of photovoltaic solar with storage microgrids in rural and peri-urban Zambia.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

sector.narrative: Electric power transmission and distribution (isolated mini-grids)

title.narrative: Chimpili and Chilongo Small Hydropower Projects, through Kleinschmidt Associates

description.narrative: A USTDA grant to Hydro Electric Power Limited, a privately-owned renewable power developer and operator in Zambia, funds a feasibility study for the development of a portfolio of small hydropower projects in Zambia, including two greenfield small hydropower projects for application under the Zambia GET FiT program and the expansion of an existing small hydropower project. The Study will assess the technical and economic viability of the sites and provide the data and analysis necessary to secure financing for implementation.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Chimpili and Chilongo Small Hydropower Projects, through Kleinschmidt Associates

description.narrative: A USTDA grant to Hydro Electric Power Limited, a privately-owned renewable power developer and operator in Zambia, funds a feasibility study ("Study") for the development of a portfolio of small hydropower projects in Zambia, including two greenfield small hydropower projects for application under the Zambia GET FiT program and the expansion of an existing small hydropower project. The Study will assess the technical and economic viability of the sites and provide the data and analysis necessary to secure financing for implementation. Successful implementation of the portfolio of projects would increase renewable energy generation, connect new customers to an existing hydropower project, and provide export opportunities for U.S. firms.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Chimpili and Chilongo Small Hydropower Projects, through Kleinschmidt Associates

description.narrative: A USTDA grant to Hydro Electric Power Limited, a privately-owned renewable power developer and operator in Zambia, funds a feasibility study ("Study") for the development of a portfolio of small hydropower projects in Zambia, including two greenfield small hydropower projects for application under the Zambia GET FiT program and the expansion of an existing small hydropower project. The Study will assess the technical and economic viability of the sites and provide the data and analysis necessary to secure financing for implementation. Successful implementation of the portfolio of projects would increase renewable energy generation, connect new customers to an existing hydropower project, and provide export opportunities for U.S. firms. U.S. firm Kleinschmidt Associates is carrying out the Study on a sole-source basis.

title.narrative: Transaction Advisory Services, through Emerging Sustainable Infrastructure Management Advisors LLC

description.narrative: This grant funds technical assistance to support transaction advisory services for the Chimpili and Chilongo small greenfield run-of-river hydropower projects and with a special focus on the financing of expansion plans for the existing Zengamina small hydropower-based mini-grid project. The TA would help the grantee Hydro Electric Power Limited and other project developers raise up to $55 million in financing.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Utility Scale Battery Energy Storage System, through K & M Advisors LLC

description.narrative: This grant to GreenCo Power Services Limited (GreenCo) funds a feasibility study to assess the technical, economic, and financial viability of developing and implementing a 10-25 megawatt (MW) / 40-100 megawatt hour (MWh) Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) pilot project (BESS Pilot Project) in Sesheke District, Zambia and a 400MWh BESS portfolio in the country. The BESS Pilot Project will be paired with a solar photovoltaic pilot project in the same region and would be one of Zambia's first utility-scale BESS projects.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

The BESS Pilot Project will be paired with a solar photovoltaic pilot project in the same region and would be one of Zambia's first utility-scale BESS projects.

description.narrative: This $7,500 desk study is reviewing a proposal for a feasibility study on the development of a proposed 5 to 15 megawatt solar photovoltaic power plant in Zambia.

title.narrative: Desk Study - Iyendwe Valley Hydropower Plant, through CORE International, Inc.

description.narrative: Desk Study - Iyendwe Valley Hydropower Plant, through CORE International, Inc.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Desk Study - Iyendwe Valley Hydropower Plant, through CORE International, Inc.

description.narrative: This $5,000 desk study reviewed a proposal for a feasibility study to evaluate the technical, financial, environmental, and other critical aspects of implementing a 15 megawatt (MW) hydropower plant in Zambias Northern Province. Currently, no sizable electricity generation facility exists in the Northern Province; the only electricity is supplied through a high voltage transmission line from southern Zambia, which is not sufficient to meet current electricity demand and is subject to low voltages and interruptions. The proposed hydropower plant would provide a dependable electricity supply, as well as significant developmental benefits and opportunities for U.S. exports.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Kalahari Geoenergy 10-20 Mw Geothermal Power Project, through Geologica Geothermal Group, Inc.

description.narrative: This grant to Kalahari GeoEnergy Limited funds a feasibility study to support the development of a 10-20 MW geothermal power plant in Zambia. The Project is anticipated to be the first commercial geothermal project developed in Zambia. The Study will be undertaken on a sole-source basis by the U.S. firm Geologica Geothermal Group, Inc.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Access Zambia 130-140 Mw Wind Power Project, through Mott MacDonald Group Ltd.

description.narrative: A USTDA grant to Access Zambia Wind One Limited is funding a feasibility study ("Study") for a 130-140 MW wind power project under development near Pensulo, Zambia ("Project"). The Study is providing the Project with the necessary technical site assessments, environmental and social assessments, legal support and documentation to allow the Project to reach financial close. The Project is anticipated to be the first utility-scale wind project in Zambia.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles
